description: Having worked within the Events Department of G4S for some five years I have experienced a great deal of roles in many venues both in the UK and overseas. Close Protection: My duties in a Close Protection capacity have included working both independently and as part of a team for several well known sports and music personalities at many world famous venues. Asset Protection: In this capacity I have been responsible for some of the most recognised trophies in the world both in the UK and Europe. General Security: I have been involved in security for many shows and exhibitions all differing in nature. These duties have been within the UK, Europe and the Middle East. Stewarding (02 arena London): Required excellent customer service, Directing large crowds, Ensuring the safety of all users of the venue.

description: At the DSEi show guests are required to pre register where possible and be verified before entering. My role in relation to this was to draft the processes and procedures that would be in place for verification , both prior to the event and onsite, and then to implement them. When contemplating the verification procedure it was important to ensure that I was complying with the Government conditions for trade licences for the exhibition. I liaised with all visitors to the show in order to ensure that verification had been carried out effectively. Visitors to the show included: Overseas embassies, Military Units both from the UK and overseas, Police units both from the UK and overseas Civil Service and Government personnel, Media. In carrying out each of these tasks I had also to bear in mind deadlines that were set by the head of security for show.

title: Radar Systems Technician
headquarters:
550 D Street West
Suite 1
Randolph AFB,
TX
78150-4527
United States
address: 550 D Street West Suite 1 Randolph AFB, TX 78150-4527 United States
name: David Stockinger
description: - Troubleshoots/replaces/adjusts radar systems components to obtain maximum equipment operating capabilities - Certifies precise/prompt installation of field level modifications, equipment time changes, and system upgrades Evaluates and resolves problems encountered during siting, installing, repairing, and overhauling ground radar systems. Uses layout drawings, schematics, and pictorial diagrams to solve maintenance problems and analyzes construction and operating characteristics of equipment to determine source of malfunctionInterprets maintenance and installation policy and procedures. Installs ground radar systems. Assembles, connects, modifies, and adjusts ground radar subassemblies such as antennas, transmitters, receivers, processors, indicator groups, and ancillary systems such as beacon equipment and video mappers. Conducts tests of installed equipment for proper component assembly and compliance with technical orders. Places in operation, calibrates, tunes, and aligns subassemblies according to approved technical data to maximize performance. Disassembles, relocates, assembles, and connects ground radar systems. Inspects and tests equipment for serviceability before and after relocation. Performs maintenance inspections on ground radar systems. After about four and a half years in Aircraft maintenance, I applied for and was accepted to cross train into the Ground Radar Systems career field. I've since been stationed at Minot AFB, maintaining the ASR-11 DASR and WSR-88D Radar Systems. I do everything from basic/advanced troubleshooting and repair, cable maintenance, fiber optic troubleshooting and splicing, software/hardware updating, and really whatever else they tell me to do! I've assisted in moving entire systems and associated networking from one our old ATC tower, to the new one. I've crawled in 3 foot tall crawl spaces to reroute cables, and repaired N-type connectors atop our DASR antenna in full climbing gear, in -30 degree weather!

description: - Operates, inspects, modifies, removes, installs, aligns & analyzes performance; troubleshoots Attack Controls and Low Altitude Navigation and Targeting Infrared for Night systems malfunctions on F-15E aircraft - Determines proper maintenance procedures; enforces supply discipline; adheres to training/safety requirements - Maintains/updates maintenance/inspection records, aircraft forms and Integrated Maintenance Data System Removes, installs, aligns, and checks integrated avionics systems. Removes and installs line replaceable units, and aligns systems. Operationally checks externally mounted avionics equipment. Boresights systems. Performs intermediate or organizational maintenance level modifications.

description: - Responsible for pilot debriefing on 492 Aircraft Maintenance Unit scheduled/unscheduled sortie reporting - Assigns System Capability Codes and Landing Status Codes based on Pilot Reported Discrepancies (PRD) - Maintains records containing 3-month flight histories for 56 assigned F-15E aircraft valued at over $3.2 billion - Services two Integrated Maintenance Information System (IMIS) servers for 260 Electronic Technical Orders - Assistant IMDS monitor. Ensured IMDS errors are reported properly and corrected in a quick & timely manner
